title: Which celebrities are defending Ellen DeGeneres without being asked to? - Quora
tags: The Ellen DeGeneres Show (TV talk show)

response.answer_text: The biggest supporter of Ellen is Portia de Rossi. She even made a hashtag for Ellen, #IStandWithEllen — sweet, isn’t it? Also not very surprising, considering the fact that De Rossi is Ellen’s wife. Gotta stand by your man or woman when times are tough. As for the other celebrities, some are supporting her fiercely, others are attacking her passionately…  Those who support her, often face significant scorn and backlash for doing so.[1] The common argument is that they do not know how awful Ellen is to those who work below her, because she apparently is rather snobby and would only mistreat you if you are ‘beneath her’. Those on her level or higher up the Hollywood ladder would get treated with kindness and respect. The saying: “Never bite the hand that feeds you”, comes to mind.  At the end of the day, I don’t know if Ellen Degeneres is a bad person or not — many people seem to have that experience, especially celebrities early on in their careers; those who already ‘have it made’, tend to be treated cordially and respectfully by her. Of course we cannot judge any book by its covers, and there has not been a lawsuit against her yet — just some ‘internal investigations’. With no ‘hard evidence’ either way, and only statements from disgruntled (former) employees and showbizz figures, I’m not going to go ‘cancel’ the woman. That said, there are a LOT of accusations, and some come from highly credibly and respectable producers, actors and entertainment industry figures. Accusations and rumors of her bad behavior go back many years, so it’s not an a case of an isolated incident. I’ll just sit tight and see what else gets spilled. And I suppose, I’ll just sip this tea a little longer! It does appear like she’s rather snobby and not a very nice boss to work for, as most reports of her bad behavior come from on-set personnel and not from her fellow celebrities. As for the toxic workplace atmosphere… she acknowledges it, but places the blame elsewhere, with no reflection on her own behavior whatsoever.
